titleInfo.title: Portrait of the Louis Anfenger Family

physicalDescription.extent: 1 item (photograph), 8 x 10 inches, black and white
physicalDescription.note: On back of photograph: ''#37 Family of Louis Anfenger Donor Marjorie Hornbein''. On envelope: ''#37 Louis Anfenger and Louis Anfenger family, c 1890s''.

mods.abstract: Louis (1842-1900) and Louise Schlesinger (1847-1938) Anfenger seated front center, with their eight children. Children, back row, left to right: Max, Fannie, Stella, Milton, and Fred. Children front row: Harold, Flora, and Joseph. Louis Anfenger was born in Bavaria and came to the United States in the 1850s. He moved west to Denver, Colorado in 1870, started out working as a clerk, and became a highly successful businessman in the area of real estate. Louise He was also elected to the state legislature in the 1880s. Anfenger built a stately house at Champa Street and Twenty-Ninth Street for his wife Louise and their large family.
mods.note: Appears in ''Images of America: Jewish Denver 1859-1940,'' by Dr. Jeanne Abrams, on page 20.

titleInfo.title: Beck Archives Photograph Collection, Families and Groups
